attributes.action: Hold a Public Vote of No Confidence in the Administration of the United Kingdom
attributes.additional_details:
There is a widespread clamouring for another referendum, but the one sought asks the wrong question & will not address the real issues.
A straightforward vote of no confidence will address the problem head on.
Parliament would need to unite to try and win the vote, & when they lose they must dissolve and a general election held in which both parties are prohibited from participating.
attributes.background:
Both government & opposition are the worst in recorded history.
Parliament is paralysed by party politics, ideology & voter disenfranchisement.
These are inevitable consequences of a political system that has broken down.
The electorate need to express their dissent & our politics must reform.
